intro: Vincetoxicum govanii, commonly known as the Indian snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to South Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It is often found in moist, shady environments such as forests and along stream banks. Due to its toxic properties, it is not typically cultivated for ornamental purposes.
